Posts.EditableText: The Quest Centre website to anybody who wants it. It's all HTML, so can easily be put on a free website server. The reason I don't want it is because I don't think I'll have enough time to work on it. I'm spending as much of my free time as possible to learn programming in different languages, web design/development, and running a small business. So I'm getting rid of anything that I don't have time for anymore. Post here or PM me if you're interested in mantaining the Quest Centre website. It's basically a website dedicated to providing tutorials and scripts for Quest games, and other little resources people may find useful. Currently over at http://www.chronicalgames.com/quest
Posts.HTML:
The Quest Centre website to anybody who wants it. It's all HTML, so can easily be put on a free website server.

The reason I don't want it is because I don't think I'll have enough time to work on it. I'm spending as much of my free time as possible to learn programming in different languages, web design/development, and running a small business. So I'm getting rid of anything that I don't have time for anymore.

Post here or PM me if you're interested in mantaining the Quest Centre website. It's basically a website dedicated to providing tutorials and scripts for Quest games, and other little resources people may find useful.

Currently over at http://www.chronicalgames.com/quest

Posts.EditableText: ME ME ME!!! Please, but can you still host it? I have no servers or money to pay for one... I would love to have the quest centre though, and I would make it good! Lots of tutorials... yes, lots....

Posts.EditableText: Hey Lexx, cool you're picking it up.  Please direct the tutorials to the complete beginner. Keep them simple, then gradually build up the difficulty level. Remember: you have more knowledge than they will, so you have to think from their perspective. I'll be contemplating a tutorial to add....

Remember: you have more knowledge than they will, so you have to think from their perspective. I'll be contemplating a tutorial to add....

Posts.EditableText: Hey thanks man, but yeah I was going to start with on how to add all the different elements, and how to use them, and was thinknig of actually not seperating ASL from QDK but putting the methods for both together... It makes more sense in my head that way. I've forgotten practically everything in QDK so they WILL go step by step, but for ASL I may asume they have [i:2bcgjrg8]some[/i:2bcgjrg8] programming knowledge at least from QDK. I'm also planning a big section on making big rpg's, and may be turning hAvenHold into an online rpg library at some point (once it's finished)... But it's not going to be a library in the normal sense, but something you build your game around... If you understand me?
Posts.HTML: Hey thanks man, but yeah I was going to start with on how to add all the different elements, and how to use them, and was thinknig of actually not seperating ASL from QDK but putting the methods for both together... It makes more sense in my head that way. I've forgotten practically everything in QDK so they WILL go step by step, but for ASL I may asume they have some programming knowledge at least from QDK. But it's not going to be a library in the normal sense, but something you build your game around... If you understand me?

Posts.EditableText: I'm currently building a game that samples many of the different functions of ASL, such as timers, flags, pauses, sound, graphics, etc.  It would be really great if I could supply you with snippets of my code to be used.
